title: Implement semantic search in API
description:
Add semantic search endpoint to API worker.

Flow:
1. User query -> OpenRouter embed -> vector
2. Vectorize similarity search -> dog IDs
3. D1 fetch dog records by IDs
4. Apply hard filters (city, size, etc)
5. Return results

Endpoint: GET /search?q=friendly+family+dog&city=warszawa
close_reason: Implemented API endpoints with CORS for dogs listing, detail, search, and shelters

close_reason: Embedding generation added to CLI pipeline. Vectorize storage happens via embedder worker queue when deployed. Tested locally: gemini-embedding-001 returns 3072-dim vectors.

title: Build first real shelter adapter
description:
Create the first production shelter adapter as a template for others.

Pick a shelter with:
- Stable URLs or external IDs
- Reasonable HTML structure
- Good variety of dog data

Adapter must:
- Compute fingerprint from stable source data (URL or ID)
- Extract rawDescription for AI processing
- Return RawDogData with all available fields

This will serve as the reference implementation for other adapters.
close_reason: Implemented TOZ Jawor adapter with JSON API integration

title: Implement DescriptionGenerator service
description:
Create DescriptionGenerator Effect service for generating consistent, warm dog bios.

## Purpose
Generate a consistent 'Dogpile style' description for every dog instead of showing raw shelter text.
This ensures uniform tone across all listings regardless of shelter writing quality.

## Depends on
- OpenRouterClient (dogpile-czv)
- JSON Schemas (dogpile-ogp)
- AI Config (dogpile-u1d)

## Interface
```typescript
interface DescriptionGenerator {
  generate: (dogData: DogData) => Effect<GeneratedBio, GenerationError>
}

interface DogData {
  name: string
  breedEstimates: BreedEstimate[]
  ageEstimate: AgeEstimate | null
  sizeEstimate: SizeEstimate | null
  personalityTags: string[]
  healthInfo: { vaccinated, sterilized, chipped }
  compatibility: { kids, dogs, cats }
  locationCity: string | null
  isFoster: boolean
  urgent: boolean
}
```

## Style Guide (from design system)
- Tone: hopeful, warm, empathetic
- Voice: active, present tense
- DO: Focus on personality, future with family, unique quirks
- DON'T: Bureaucratic language, sad backstory focus, 'Subject is...'
- Length: 2-3 short paragraphs
- Language: Polish

## System Prompt Structure
1. You are writing for Dogpile, a dog adoption platform
2. Style guide rules
3. Example good/bad descriptions
4. Input format explanation

## Implementation
1. Use OpenRouterClient.responses() with MODEL_DESCRIPTION_GEN
2. Feed structured DogData (NOT raw shelter text) to avoid hallucination
3. response_format: { type: 'json_schema', json_schema: DogBioSchema }
4. Validate output

Location: packages/core/src/services/ai/description-generator.ts
close_reason: Implemented DescriptionGenerator for dog bios

Scraper: Schronisko w Nowym Dworze Mazowieckim
Create prompt template files
description:
Create markdown prompt files that are loaded at runtime. Prompts should NOT be hardcoded in code.

## Directory Structure
```
packages/core/prompts/
├── text-extraction.md     # System prompt for extracting data from shelter text
├── photo-analysis.md      # System prompt for analyzing dog photos
├── description-gen.md     # System prompt for generating dog bios
└── README.md              # Documentation on prompt format and variables
```

## Prompt File Format
Each .md file contains:
1. System prompt content
2. Variable placeholders using {{VARIABLE}} syntax
3. Comments (will be stripped) using <!-- --> 

Example text-extraction.md:
```markdown
<!-- Variables: {{RAW_DESCRIPTION}} -->

Jesteś ekspertem w analizie ogłoszeń adopcyjnych psów ze schronisk w Polsce.

Twoim zadaniem jest wyekstrahowanie ustrukturyzowanych danych z tekstu ogłoszenia.

## Zasady
- Wszystkie pola opcjonalne - użyj null jeśli brak informacji
- Wiek podaj w miesiącach (1 rok = 12 miesięcy)
- Rasy wybieraj z podanej listy enum
...
```

## Language Rules
- Prompt content: POLISH (for LLM to respond in Polish)
- Variable names: ENGLISH
- Schema field names: ENGLISH
- Enum values: ENGLISH

## Implementation
1. Create PromptLoader service that reads .md files
2. Cache loaded prompts (they don't change at runtime)
3. Support variable substitution: `{{VAR}}` -> value
4. Strip HTML comments before sending to LLM
5. In development, reload on file change (optional)

## Prompt Loading in Workers
Since Cloudflare Workers can't read filesystem, prompts must be:
- Bundled at build time (import as string)
- Or stored in KV and loaded at runtime

Recommend: Bundle at build time using Bun's text loader

Location: packages/core/prompts/
close_reason: Created Polish prompt templates for AI extraction and bio generation

Implement EmbeddingService
description:
Create EmbeddingService Effect service for generating vector embeddings.

## Depends on
- OpenRouterClient (dogpile-czv)
- AI Config (dogpile-u1d)

## Interface
```typescript
interface EmbeddingService {
  embed: (text: string) => Effect<readonly number[], EmbeddingError>
  embedBatch: (texts: readonly string[]) => Effect<readonly (readonly number[])[], EmbeddingError>
}
```

## Implementation
1. Use OpenRouterClient.embeddings() with MODEL_EMBEDDING
2. Default model: google/gemini-embedding-001 (good for Polish)
3. Batch requests for efficiency (Embeddings API supports array input)

## API Call
```typescript
POST /api/v1/embeddings
{
  model: 'google/gemini-embedding-001',
  input: ['text1', 'text2', ...]
}
```

## Response
```typescript
{
  data: [
    { embedding: number[], index: 0 },
    { embedding: number[], index: 1 },
    ...
  ]
}
```

## Usage
- Called by embedder worker for new dogs
- Called by API worker for search queries
- Cache embeddings - they're deterministic

Location: packages/core/src/services/ai/embedding.ts
close_reason: Implemented EmbeddingService with OpenRouter embeddings

title: Create OpenRouterClient base service
description:
Implement low-level OpenRouterClient Effect service for all OpenRouter API interactions.

## Endpoints
- Responses API: POST /api/v1/responses (new stateless API, NOT legacy /chat/completions)
- Embeddings API: POST /api/v1/embeddings

## Responsibilities
- Authentication: Bearer token from OPENROUTER_API_KEY
- Retry logic: Exponential backoff on 429 (rate limit) and 5xx errors
- Error mapping to tagged Effect errors

## Methods
```typescript
interface OpenRouterClient {
  responses: (request: ResponsesRequest) => Effect<ResponsesResult, OpenRouterError>
  embeddings: (request: EmbeddingsRequest) => Effect<EmbeddingsResult, OpenRouterError>
}
```

## Error Types
- OpenRouterError: { status, body, code }
- RateLimitError: extends OpenRouterError (triggers retry)
- SchemaValidationError: { issues } (response didn't match expected schema)

## Configuration
Read from Effect.Config:
- OPENROUTER_API_KEY (secret, required)
- OPENROUTER_BASE_URL (optional, default https://openrouter.ai/api/v1)

Location: packages/core/src/services/openrouter/client.ts
close_reason: Implemented OpenRouterClient with responses/embeddings endpoints, retry logic, and proper config

title: Wire AI extraction into scraper-processor pipeline
description:
Integrate AIExtractionService into scraper-processor worker.

Flow:
1. Scraper returns RawDogData with fingerprint + rawDescription
2. If new dog (fingerprint not in DB):
   - Run text extraction on rawDescription
   - Download photos to R2
   - Run photo extraction on photos
   - Merge results and store in D1
   - Queue for embedding generation
3. If existing dog (fingerprint match):
   - Just update lastSeenAt

Requires dogpile-4jr (AIExtractionService) and dogpile-2o2 (shelter adapter) to be complete.
close_reason: Integrated AI extraction into scraper-processor pipeline

Add generatedBio field to Dog schema
description:
Update Dog schema to store AI-generated biography separately from rawDescription.

## Schema Changes
```sql
dog:
  + generatedBio TEXT     -- AI-generated 'Dogpile style' description
  + bioGeneratedAt INTEGER -- When bio was generated (for cache invalidation)
```

## Domain Type Update
packages/core/src/domain/dog.ts:
```typescript
generatedBio: Schema.NullOr(Schema.String),
bioGeneratedAt: Schema.NullOr(Schema.Date),
```

## Frontend Display Logic
- If generatedBio exists: show it
- If not: show rawDescription as fallback
- Never show both

## Migration
- Add columns to existing dogs table
- Set generatedBio = null initially
- Bio will be generated on next scrape or via backfill job
close_reason: Added generatedBio field to Dog domain and DB schema

title: Scraper: Fundacja Tabby Burasy i Spółka
Scraper: Małopolska Org. na Rzecz Natury MORN
Define JSON Schemas for structured outputs
description:
Create Effect Schema definitions that generate JSON Schemas for OpenRouter structured outputs.

## CRITICAL: Use structured outputs with strict: true
Do NOT use prompt-based 'return JSON' - use OpenRouter's response_format parameter:
```typescript
{
  response_format: {
    type: 'json_schema',
    json_schema: {
      name: 'dog_extraction',
      strict: true,
      schema: { ... } // Generated from Effect Schema
    }
  }
}
```

## Schemas to Define

### TextExtractionSchema
Output of text analysis - what we extract from shelter description:
- name, sex, ageEstimate, breedEstimates, sizeEstimate, weightEstimate
- personalityTags[], healthInfo, compatibility
- locationHints (foster/shelter, city mentions)

### PhotoExtractionSchema
Output of photo analysis - physical traits:
- breedEstimates, sizeEstimate, ageCategory
- furLength, furType, colorPrimary, colorSecondary, colorPattern
- earType, tailType

### DogBioSchema
Output of description generation:
- bio: string (the generated description)
- tone: 'hopeful' | 'urgent' | 'gentle' (for validation)

## Implementation
1. Define using Effect Schema (packages/core/src/schemas/)
2. Create utility to convert Effect Schema -> JSON Schema for OpenRouter
3. Create runtime decoders for response validation
4. Ensure all optional fields use Schema.NullOr (strict mode requires explicit nullability)

Reference: https://openrouter.ai/docs/guides/features/structured-outputs
close_reason: Created Effect Schemas for text/photo extraction and dog bio with JSON Schema utility

title: Create Cloudflare resources and configure wrangler
description:
Create all required Cloudflare resources for dogpile.extropy.club:

## Resources to Create
- D1 database: dogpile-db
- KV namespace: dogpile-cache
- R2 bucket: dogpile-photos-original
- R2 bucket: dogpile-photos-generated
- Vectorize index: dogpile-dogs
- Queues: dogpile-scrape-jobs, dogpile-reindex-jobs

## Domain Setup
- Domain: extropy.club (already owned)
- Subdomain: dogpile.extropy.club
- Configure DNS and SSL

## Steps
1. Create resources via wrangler CLI or dashboard
2. Update all wrangler.toml files with actual resource IDs
3. Configure custom domain for web worker
4. Set up OPENROUTER_API_KEY secret: `wrangler secret put OPENROUTER_API_KEY`
5. Run initial D1 migrations

## Wrangler Commands
```bash
wrangler d1 create dogpile-db
wrangler kv:namespace create dogpile-cache
wrangler r2 bucket create dogpile-photos-original
wrangler r2 bucket create dogpile-photos-generated
wrangler vectorize create dogpile-dogs --dimensions 768 --metric cosine
wrangler queues create dogpile-scrape-jobs
wrangler queues create dogpile-reindex-jobs
```
close_reason: Created all CF resources and applied D1 migrations

title: Create AI configuration system
description:
Create configuration system for AI models using Effect.Config.

## Environment Variables
```
OPENROUTER_API_KEY=sk-...                           # Required, secret

# Models (all with reasoning enabled where supported)
MODEL_TEXT_EXTRACTION=x-ai/grok-4.1-fast            # Extract data from shelter text
MODEL_PHOTO_ANALYSIS=google/gemini-3-flash-preview  # Analyze dog photos  
MODEL_DESCRIPTION_GEN=google/gemini-3-flash-preview # Generate dog bios
MODEL_EMBEDDING=google/gemini-embedding-001         # Vector embeddings
```

## Implementation
1. Create AIConfig type with all model settings
2. Use Effect.Config with defaults for each model
3. Create .env.example with all variables documented
4. Update all wrangler.toml files with [vars] defaults
5. Document how to set secrets via 'wrangler secret put'

## Effect Pattern
```typescript
export const AIConfig = Config.all({
  apiKey: Config.redacted('OPENROUTER_API_KEY'),
  textExtractionModel: Config.string('MODEL_TEXT_EXTRACTION').pipe(
    Config.withDefault('x-ai/grok-4.1-fast')
  ),
  photoAnalysisModel: Config.string('MODEL_PHOTO_ANALYSIS').pipe(
    Config.withDefault('google/gemini-3-flash-preview')
  ),
  descriptionGenModel: Config.string('MODEL_DESCRIPTION_GEN').pipe(
    Config.withDefault('google/gemini-3-flash-preview')
  ),
  embeddingModel: Config.string('MODEL_EMBEDDING').pipe(
    Config.withDefault('google/gemini-embedding-001')
  ),
})
```

## Reasoning Mode
For models that support it, enable reasoning in the request:
```typescript
{
  model: 'google/gemini-3-flash-preview',
  reasoning: { effort: 'medium' }  // or as per OpenRouter docs
}
```

Location: packages/core/src/config/ai.ts
close_reason: Created AIConfig with model configuration using Effect.Config

title: Implement PhotoAnalyzer service
description:
Create PhotoAnalyzer Effect service for extracting physical traits from dog photos.

## Depends on
- OpenRouterClient (dogpile-czv)
- JSON Schemas (dogpile-ogp)
- AI Config (dogpile-u1d)

## Interface
```typescript
interface PhotoAnalyzer {
  analyze: (photoUrls: readonly string[]) => Effect<PhotoExtractionResult, ExtractionError>
  analyzeSingle: (photoUrl: string) => Effect<PhotoExtractionResult, ExtractionError>
}
```

## Implementation
1. Use OpenRouterClient.responses() with MODEL_PHOTO_ANALYSIS
2. Pass images via URL (OpenRouter/Gemini support image URLs directly)
3. If multiple photos, analyze best one or merge results
4. response_format: { type: 'json_schema', json_schema: PhotoExtractionSchema }
5. Validate with Effect Schema decoder

## Considerations
- Prefer image URLs over base64 (token efficiency)
- If shelter images are not public, may need to proxy through R2
- Handle poor quality / multiple dogs in photo gracefully
- Extract confidence levels for breed estimates

Location: packages/core/src/services/ai/photo-analyzer.ts
close_reason: Implemented PhotoAnalyzer with image input support

Implement TextExtractor service
description:
Create TextExtractor Effect service for extracting structured dog data from shelter text.

## Depends on
- OpenRouterClient (dogpile-czv)
- JSON Schemas (dogpile-ogp)
- AI Config (dogpile-u1d)

## Interface
```typescript
interface TextExtractor {
  extract: (rawDescription: string) => Effect<TextExtractionResult, ExtractionError>
}
```

## Implementation
1. Use OpenRouterClient.responses() with MODEL_TEXT_EXTRACTION
2. System prompt: extraction instructions with examples
3. User message: the raw shelter description
4. response_format: { type: 'json_schema', json_schema: TextExtractionSchema }
5. Parse response with Effect Schema decoder
6. Map errors appropriately

## Prompt Engineering
- Handle Polish language text
- Extract all possible fields, use null for missing
- Recognize common Polish shelter terminology
- Handle inconsistent formatting gracefully
